title: 20 Editor-Approved Skin-Care Sets to Solidify Your Beauty Routine
description: Whether you're shopping for yourself or others, there’s power in numbers.
excerpt: Looking for the best skin care sets for yourself or someone else? These 20 are editor-approved, effective, and worth every penny.
text: Best for Skin Renewal Eighth Day The Performance DuoProsSmoothes and brightens skin ConsAcid-heavy formula can be too harsh for sensitive skinWith the sun tucked away for a few months, now’s the time to introduce stronger exfoliants into your arsenal. This set features Eighth Day’s full-sized signature Resurfacing Tonic, packed with lactic and glycolic acid to slough away dead skin for a brighter complexion, and Regenerative Serum to ward off signs of aging.Nordstrom rating: 5/5 stars A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I purchased the Eighth Day performance duo to ease some of my fine lines and invigorate my skin. They have done just that! I also use the toner and eye cream and am just so pleased with the results. I highly recommend these superb products as they really work!” Best for Gentle Exfoliation Sunday Riley Power Couple KitConsMay not be suited for very sensitive skinIntroducing retinol into your skin-care routine isn’t as easy as it seems. But this Sunday Riley duo, featuring the holy grail Good Genes treatment, is gentle yet powerful enough to deliver some serious results.Amazon rating: 4.5/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “I’m obsessed! This was definitely worth it! I instantly could see a difference in my skin! Definitely helps get ahead of the wrinkles if you start this early.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Under-Eye Masks 111SKIN Jetsetter Wallet Skin Care SetProsDe-puffs and brightensIn-flight skin care routines are all the rage on TikTok. Join the bandwagon with this luxurious trio from 111Skin. Featuring three under-eye masks, each formulated to de-puff and brighten, you’ll be on your way to firmer, smoother under-eyes in just 20 minutes. Best for RadianceDermalogica The Expertise KitProsComes with vitamin C serum and eye creamConsCan be too harsh for those with sensitive skinWith this curated set, Dermalogica provides all the essentials to make your AM and PM skin care routine feel like you just stepped out of a facial. Cleanse and buff away all traces of dirt with the cleanser and exfoliating powder; treat your skin to a boost of radiance with two different vitamin C formulas and a retinol. Of course, you can’t forget sunscreen, and Dermalogica’s Dynamic Skin Recovery SPF is one of the best on the market. Dermalogica rating: 4.6A Dermalogica reviewer says: “Absolutely love these products! Worth the money! I’ve never had a great skin regimen and now that I do, I have gotten so many compliments on my skin. Already buying more!”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for the TikTok Beauty ObsessiveGlow Recipe Fruit Babies Skincare KitCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsSome may dislike the scentEveryone online is obsessed with Glow Recipe, and now you can try five of its bestsellers in a perfectly curated set. Featuring watermelon extract, hyaluronic acid, retinol, and more, these products will help your skin look plump, glowing, hydrated, and dewy–basically, everything you could ever want. Amazon rating: 4.6/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “I loved the set so much I use it every day. I have extremely sensitive skin, and it’s the one product that has not made me break out. For that, it’s five stars by itself on top of the fact that the products are true to the name.”Best for BeginnersYouth to the People The Youth System Credit: Courtesy of the brandsConsCleanser glass can get slipperyFor fans of clean skin care with excellent results, look no further than Youth to the People. This skin care set includes six incredible products: its best-selling cleanser, vitamin C serum, moisturizer, face oil, eye cream, and face mask.Sephora rating: 4.9/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “This is the cleanser everyone in my house loves to steal. Not only is it gentle, but it’s super hydrating and effective at removing whatever my cleansing balm left behind. I brought this on a friend’s trip recently and was left with not one ounce to return home with because it’s just that good.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Korean Skin-Care SetInnisfree Hydrate + Protect Bestseller Minis SetCredit: Courtesy of the brandsProsGreat for all skin typesConsSuncreen may not be best for oily skin If you love a dewy finish, Innisfree’s airy products are highly recommended by TikTokers, makeup artists, and ELLE editors. This set guarantees hydration and protection, thanks to the hyaluronic acid—and green tea-infused serum and face cream, along with the nourishing sunscreen that leaves a subtle glow. Sephora rating: 4.9/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “I rotate a lot of products in my travel cosmetics bag, but this trio is a mainstay. I prefer no-fuss products that do exactly what they say, and this set offers a surge of hydration. I seal it all in with the nourishing sunscreen that doesn’t leave a white cast.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor Best for Dewy SkinRhode The Rhode KitProsComes with three lip treatmentsConsMay not be suitable for super sensitive skin High on the list of perfect celebrity skin is none other than Hailey Bieber herself. Good thing she created a line of products that make radiant, smooth skin a reality instead of a dream. The kit comes with the Pineapple Cleanser, Barrier Restore Cream, the Peptide Glazing Fluid, and Glazing Milk.Rhode rating: 4.6/5 starsA Rhode reviewer said: “Absolutely incredible products! Finally, a brand that has smashed the skin-care market with perfect ingredients, texture, and the most stunning packaging!! Safe to say I am one happy glazed girly!”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for BrighteningSkinCeuticals Best Sellers Gift SetCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsMay be too strong for sensitive skinReverse dull, dehydrated skin with the Skinceuticals Best Sellers set. Featuring the C E Ferulic Acid treatment, hyaluronic acid, and anti-aging cream, the trio combats aging skin while reducing the appearance of dark marks over time. SkinCeuticals rating: 4.6/5 starsA SkinCeuticals reviewer says: “There is no other vitamin C that comes remotely close to this product. This product is superior to them all. I firmly believe that not all skincare needs to be super expensive, but when it comes to ingredients like vitamin C, you get what you pay for. This profit has a hefty price tag, but if you want something that works, improves your skin’s look, and reduces hyperpigmentation, this is your guy. Stop spending money on trying so many products that don’t yield results and invest in one that will blow you away. This is the one.”Best for AcneLa Roche-Posay Effaclar Dermatological Acne TreatmentCredit: Courtesy of the brandsProsEffectively treats blemishesConsCan be somewhat dryingThis French pharmacy brand has curated a three-step process for ditching breakouts. With salicylic acid and benzoyl peroxide, this set includes a cleanser, toner, and spot treatment to rapidly clear even the most stubborn breakouts.Ulta rating: 4.3/5 stars An Ulta reviewer said: “This product really works as a trio. I’ve been using it for two months, and I honestly can say I haven’t used anything that truly works for me like this. You have to be patient; it took over 30 days so you can see and feel the difference!”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for Glass SkinPeach & Lily Glass Skin Discovery KitCredit: Courtesy of the brandsThese days, everyone is chasing glass skin, but it is not all that hard to achieve when you have the right products. This set contains a mask, essence, refining serum, and hydrating cream so that you can become a skincare influencer. Key ingredients include nourishing hyaluronic acid and peach extract, antioxidant-rich matcha, and pore-minimizing niacinamide. Ulta rating: 4.6/5 starsOur expert reviewer says: “The Glass Skin Refining Serum is the hero of this skin set foursome; however, with their powers combined, this set will leave you with oh-so-dewy skin for a great price.”—Danielle James, beauty expert Best for Dry SkinTatcha The Starter RitualCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsOnly one full sized product Dehydrated skin needs some extra love, and this skin-care set from Tatcha gives an undeniable boost of hydration. With a moisturizer, serum, and softening cleanser boasting powerhouse Japanese ingredients, you’ll be on your way to supple, smooth skin in no time.Tatcha rating: 4.7/5 starsA Tatcha reviewer says: “I was extremely apprehensive about buying a product from this skin care line, but I decided to order The Starter Ritual. I received the products in very nice packaging along with easy instructions. I used the products before I went to sleep, and by morning, my face was already glowing! Tatcha is now my skin-care routine.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for All Skin TypesRenée Rouleau The Essential Skin Care Collection: Skin Type 3Credit: Courtesy of the brandsThis collection helped me fade years of impurities in a matter of months. Renee Rouleau’s products are grouped together by skin type to ensure each one targets specific concerns.Renée Rouleau rating: 5/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “My stubborn acne-prone skin met its match when Renee Rouleau products entered my life. Clear standouts are the Detox Cleanser—a cool yellow tone that makes my early morning skin routine a pleasant experience and gently washes away the night (or day)—and BHA Clarifying Serum, a miracle worker for dark marks.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editorBest for HydrationLaneige Water Bank Blue Hyaluronic Hydration SetCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsMay leave behind a slight tacky feelingWe want our skin care to feel lightweight and breathable. Laneige’s Water Bank set includes the brand’s mega-hydrating moisturizer, which effortlessly sinks into the skin. The set also comes with a serum, eye cream, and toner, all made with the same star ingredients—including blue hyaluronic acid (a patented form of hyaluronic acid derived from deep sea algae), firming peptides, and ceramides to protect. Amazon rating: 4.7/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “I bought this on a whim and love it! It layers nicely over my skin care while still looking nice under sunscreen and foundation. It’s super hydrating but dries down without looking too glazed and dewy. Doesn’t leave a film or oily texture. I liked it so much I’m onto my second container of it.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for Hyperpigmentation Good Molecules Blemish Scar & Discoloration DuoConsTakes time to see resultsDon’t let discoloration get you down. This skin-care duo, suitable for all skin types, targets dark spots, blemishes, and hyperpigmentation using brightening niacinamide and tranexamic acid for a more even skin tone.Ulta rating: 4.3/5 stars An ELLE editor says: “I love all things Good Molecules because the products do what they claim and are affordable. This duo has the power to transform those stubborn dark marks into clearer, brighter skin you can be proud of.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editorBest Drugstore BuyE.l.f. Hydrated Ever After Skin Care Mini KitCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsMay not be suited for oily skinHotel skin care isn’t always the best for your skin. Never leave home without this reliable skin-care travel kit, which has your hydration needs completely covered from start to finish. E.l.f.’s hydration kit comes in travel-friendly sizes and includes the brand’s hydrating face cream, cleansing balm, eye cream, serum, and gentle cleanser.Amazon rating: 4.4/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “When it comes to travel skin care, I don’t like to break the bank. This set from E.L.F is the best travel buddy anyone could have since it has a complete routine that is gentle and effective enough for all skin types and costs less than an airport cocktail.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest For BalanceButtah Skin Skin Transforming Cocoshea 3-Piece KitCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsTakes time to see resultsThis three-piece skin-care set from Buttah includes all the saviors you need to brighten, nourish, and refresh dull, dehydrated skin. It includes a gentle cleanser, a vitamin C serum, and a quenching shea butter cream.Ulta rating: 4.6/5 starsOur expert reviewer says: “I bought this skin care system for an ex-boyfriend. It was the perfect introductory skin-care regime that didn’t overwhelm him. The products work so well that I felt comfortable enough leaving my routine at home and using his when I was at his apartment. It’s an easy, targeted routine with a lot of recognizable ingredients like shea butter and vitamin C. I noticed improvements in his skin within six weeks.” —Danielle James, beauty expertCelebrity FavoriteiS CLINICAL Pure Renewal CollectionCredit: Courtesy of the brandsProsGreat for all skin typesThis celebrity-favorite skin-care brand might cost a pretty penny, but it is worth it if you want radiant, glowing skin. Hollywood estheticians like Shani Darden, responsible for the skin of stars, including Jessica Alba and Rosie Huntington-Whitely, frequently use this product. Within these formulas are a range of botanicals, peptides, and powerful antioxidants that work to brighten, calm, and hydrate your barrier. Amazon rating: 4.1/5 starsAn Amazon reviewer says: “I use this with the iS Pro-Heal Serum and iS Super Serum, and it has been helping my skin to not break out as much and also heal faster when I do have a breakout.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for Instant Hydration Silver Mirror Foundational Formulas BundleCredit: Courtesy of the brandsConsMay need to go in with another cleanser for heavier makeup If you’ve ever received a facial from Silver Mirror Bar, you walked out with skin in tip-top shape and better than how you arrived. Well, the expertise of the popular facial spot has translated to skin-care offerings that keep your skin glowing at home. This bundle builds the approach around one mission: to hydrate and moisturize. Silver Mirror rating: 5/5 stars A Silver Mirror reviewer says: “The best part of this bundle is that it saves me money while giving me everything I need for my skin-care routine. Highly recommend!”Best Exfoliating Pads Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare Alpha Beta® Universal Daily Peel Pads Credit: Courtesy of the brandsProsReduces appearance of dark scars ConsMay not be best for super sensitive skin When done correctly, exfoliation offers the best results for clear, smooth skin. Dr. Dennis Gross’s fan-favorite exfoliating pads simplify the process with just two steps: Swipe the first half of the packet along your face, wait two minutes, and then soothe the skin with the second pad.Sephora rating: 4.5/5 starsAn ELLE editor says: “Whenever a Sephora sale rolls around, I have to restock on these exfoliating pads (the price is a pretty penny, so save where you can!) because my skin loves every drop of product in them. I’m troubled with dark spots (recovering picker), so this box helps to minimize the look of my scars without overly drying my skin or causing more irritation.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editorNerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture. Tatjana Freund is Hearst's Fashion & Luxury Commerce Editor, covering beauty, fashion and more across multiple brands. Previously, she worked at ELLE.com and Marie Claire. She's a fan of whiskey neat, podcasts that give her nightmares, and one time Zoë Kravitz laughed at a joke she made.
html:
Best for Skin Renewal

Eighth Day The Performance Duo

Pros
  • Smoothes and brightens skin
Cons
  • Acid-heavy formula can be too harsh for sensitive skin

With the sun tucked away for a few months, now’s the time to introduce stronger exfoliants into your arsenal. This set features Eighth Day’s full-sized signature Resurfacing Tonic, packed with lactic and glycolic acid to slough away dead skin for a brighter complexion, and Regenerative Serum to ward off signs of aging.

Nordstrom rating: 5/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I purchased the Eighth Day performance duo to ease some of my fine lines and invigorate my skin. They have done just that! I also use the toner and eye cream and am just so pleased with the results. I highly recommend these superb products as they really work!”

Best for Gentle Exfoliation

Sunday Riley Power Couple Kit

Cons
  • May not be suited for very sensitive skin

Introducing retinol into your skin-care routine isn’t as easy as it seems. But this Sunday Riley duo, featuring the holy grail Good Genes treatment, is gentle yet powerful enough to deliver some serious results.

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’m obsessed! This was definitely worth it! I instantly could see a difference in my skin! Definitely helps get ahead of the wrinkles if you start this early.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Under-Eye Masks

111SKIN Jetsetter Wallet Skin Care Set

Pros
  • De-puffs and brightens

In-flight skin care routines are all the rage on TikTok. Join the bandwagon with this luxurious trio from 111Skin. Featuring three under-eye masks, each formulated to de-puff and brighten, you’ll be on your way to firmer, smoother under-eyes in just 20 minutes.

Best for Radiance

Dermalogica The Expertise Kit

Pros
  • Comes with vitamin C serum and eye cream
Cons
  • Can be too harsh for those with sensitive skin

With this curated set, Dermalogica provides all the essentials to make your AM and PM skin care routine feel like you just stepped out of a facial. Cleanse and buff away all traces of dirt with the cleanser and exfoliating powder; treat your skin to a boost of radiance with two different vitamin C formulas and a retinol. Of course, you can’t forget sunscreen, and Dermalogica’s Dynamic Skin Recovery SPF is one of the best on the market.

Dermalogica rating: 4.6

A Dermalogica reviewer says: “Absolutely love these products! Worth the money! I’ve never had a great skin regimen and now that I do, I have gotten so many compliments on my skin. Already buying more!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for the TikTok Beauty Obsessive

Glow Recipe Fruit Babies Skincare Kit

Cons
  • Some may dislike the scent

Everyone online is obsessed with Glow Recipe, and now you can try five of its bestsellers in a perfectly curated set. Featuring watermelon extract, hyaluronic acid, retinol, and more, these products will help your skin look plump, glowing, hydrated, and dewy–basically, everything you could ever want.

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I loved the set so much I use it every day. I have extremely sensitive skin, and it’s the one product that has not made me break out. For that, it’s five stars by itself on top of the fact that the products are true to the name.”

Best for Beginners

Youth to the People The Youth System

Cons
  • Cleanser glass can get slippery

For fans of clean skin care with excellent results, look no further than Youth to the People. This skin care set includes six incredible products: its best-selling cleanser, vitamin C serum, moisturizer, face oil, eye cream, and face mask.

Sephora rating: 4.9/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “This is the cleanser everyone in my house loves to steal. Not only is it gentle, but it’s super hydrating and effective at removing whatever my cleansing balm left behind. I brought this on a friend’s trip recently and was left with not one ounce to return home with because it’s just that good.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Korean Skin-Care Set

Innisfree Hydrate + Protect Bestseller Minis Set

Pros
  • Great for all skin types
Cons
  • Suncreen may not be best for oily skin

If you love a dewy finish, Innisfree’s airy products are highly recommended by TikTokers, makeup artists, and ELLE editors. This set guarantees hydration and protection, thanks to the hyaluronic acid—and green tea-infused serum and face cream, along with the nourishing sunscreen that leaves a subtle glow.

Sephora rating: 4.9/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I rotate a lot of products in my travel cosmetics bag, but this trio is a mainstay. I prefer no-fuss products that do exactly what they say, and this set offers a surge of hydration. I seal it all in with the nourishing sunscreen that doesn’t leave a white cast.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Best for Dewy Skin

Rhode The Rhode Kit

Pros
  • Comes with three lip treatments
Cons
  • May not be suitable for super sensitive skin

High on the list of perfect celebrity skin is none other than Hailey Bieber herself. Good thing she created a line of products that make radiant, smooth skin a reality instead of a dream. The kit comes with the Pineapple Cleanser, Barrier Restore Cream, the Peptide Glazing Fluid, and Glazing Milk.

Rhode rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Rhode reviewer said: “Absolutely incredible products! Finally, a brand that has smashed the skin-care market with perfect ingredients, texture, and the most stunning packaging!! Safe to say I am one happy glazed girly!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Brightening

SkinCeuticals Best Sellers Gift Set

Cons
  • May be too strong for sensitive skin

Reverse dull, dehydrated skin with the Skinceuticals Best Sellers set. Featuring the C E Ferulic Acid treatment, hyaluronic acid, and anti-aging cream, the trio combats aging skin while reducing the appearance of dark marks over time.

SkinCeuticals rating: 4.6/5 stars

A SkinCeuticals reviewer says: “There is no other vitamin C that comes remotely close to this product. This product is superior to them all. I firmly believe that not all skincare needs to be super expensive, but when it comes to ingredients like vitamin C, you get what you pay for. This profit has a hefty price tag, but if you want something that works, improves your skin’s look, and reduces hyperpigmentation, this is your guy. Stop spending money on trying so many products that don’t yield results and invest in one that will blow you away. This is the one.”

Best for Acne

La Roche-Posay Effaclar Dermatological Acne Treatment

Pros
  • Effectively treats blemishes
Cons
  • Can be somewhat drying

This French pharmacy brand has curated a three-step process for ditching breakouts. With salicylic acid and benzoyl peroxide, this set includes a cleanser, toner, and spot treatment to rapidly clear even the most stubborn breakouts.

Ulta rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer said: “This product really works as a trio. I’ve been using it for two months, and I honestly can say I haven’t used anything that truly works for me like this. You have to be patient; it took over 30 days so you can see and feel the difference!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Glass Skin

Peach & Lily Glass Skin Discovery Kit

These days, everyone is chasing glass skin, but it is not all that hard to achieve when you have the right products. This set contains a mask, essence, refining serum, and hydrating cream so that you can become a skincare influencer. Key ingredients include nourishing hyaluronic acid and peach extract, antioxidant-rich matcha, and pore-minimizing niacinamide.

Ulta rating: 4.6/5 stars

Our expert reviewer says: “The Glass Skin Refining Serum is the hero of this skin set foursome; however, with their powers combined, this set will leave you with oh-so-dewy skin for a great price.”—Danielle James, beauty expert

Best for Dry Skin

Tatcha The Starter Ritual

Cons
  • Only one full sized product

Dehydrated skin needs some extra love, and this skin-care set from Tatcha gives an undeniable boost of hydration. With a moisturizer, serum, and softening cleanser boasting powerhouse Japanese ingredients, you’ll be on your way to supple, smooth skin in no time.

Tatcha rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Tatcha reviewer says: “I was extremely apprehensive about buying a product from this skin care line, but I decided to order The Starter Ritual. I received the products in very nice packaging along with easy instructions. I used the products before I went to sleep, and by morning, my face was already glowing! Tatcha is now my skin-care routine.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for All Skin Types

Renée Rouleau The Essential Skin Care Collection: Skin Type 3

This collection helped me fade years of impurities in a matter of months. Renee Rouleau’s products are grouped together by skin type to ensure each one targets specific concerns.

Renée Rouleau rating: 5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “My stubborn acne-prone skin met its match when Renee Rouleau products entered my life. Clear standouts are the Detox Cleanser—a cool yellow tone that makes my early morning skin routine a pleasant experience and gently washes away the night (or day)—and BHA Clarifying Serum, a miracle worker for dark marks.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Best for Hydration

Laneige Water Bank Blue Hyaluronic Hydration Set

Cons
  • May leave behind a slight tacky feeling

We want our skin care to feel lightweight and breathable. Laneige’s Water Bank set includes the brand’s mega-hydrating moisturizer, which effortlessly sinks into the skin. The set also comes with a serum, eye cream, and toner, all made with the same star ingredients—including blue hyaluronic acid (a patented form of hyaluronic acid derived from deep sea algae), firming peptides, and ceramides to protect.

Amazon rating: 4.7/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I bought this on a whim and love it! It layers nicely over my skin care while still looking nice under sunscreen and foundation. It’s super hydrating but dries down without looking too glazed and dewy. Doesn’t leave a film or oily texture. I liked it so much I’m onto my second container of it.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Hyperpigmentation

Good Molecules Blemish Scar & Discoloration Duo

Cons
  • Takes time to see results

Don’t let discoloration get you down. This skin-care duo, suitable for all skin types, targets dark spots, blemishes, and hyperpigmentation using brightening niacinamide and tranexamic acid for a more even skin tone.

Ulta rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I love all things Good Molecules because the products do what they claim and are affordable. This duo has the power to transform those stubborn dark marks into clearer, brighter skin you can be proud of.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Best Drugstore Buy

E.l.f. Hydrated Ever After Skin Care Mini Kit

Cons
  • May not be suited for oily skin

Hotel skin care isn’t always the best for your skin. Never leave home without this reliable skin-care travel kit, which has your hydration needs completely covered from start to finish. E.l.f.’s hydration kit comes in travel-friendly sizes and includes the brand’s hydrating face cream, cleansing balm, eye cream, serum, and gentle cleanser.

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “When it comes to travel skin care, I don’t like to break the bank. This set from E.L.F is the best travel buddy anyone could have since it has a complete routine that is gentle and effective enough for all skin types and costs less than an airport cocktail.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best For Balance

Buttah Skin Skin Transforming Cocoshea 3-Piece Kit

Cons
  • Takes time to see results

This three-piece skin-care set from Buttah includes all the saviors you need to brighten, nourish, and refresh dull, dehydrated skin. It includes a gentle cleanser, a vitamin C serum, and a quenching shea butter cream.

Ulta rating: 4.6/5 stars

Our expert reviewer says: “I bought this skin care system for an ex-boyfriend. It was the perfect introductory skin-care regime that didn’t overwhelm him. The products work so well that I felt comfortable enough leaving my routine at home and using his when I was at his apartment. It’s an easy, targeted routine with a lot of recognizable ingredients like shea butter and vitamin C. I noticed improvements in his skin within six weeks.” —Danielle James, beauty expert

Celebrity Favorite

iS CLINICAL Pure Renewal Collection

Pros
  • Great for all skin types

This celebrity-favorite skin-care brand might cost a pretty penny, but it is worth it if you want radiant, glowing skin. Hollywood estheticians like Shani Darden, responsible for the skin of stars, including Jessica Alba and Rosie Huntington-Whitely, frequently use this product. Within these formulas are a range of botanicals, peptides, and powerful antioxidants that work to brighten, calm, and hydrate your barrier.

Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I use this with the iS Pro-Heal Serum and iS Super Serum, and it has been helping my skin to not break out as much and also heal faster when I do have a breakout.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Instant Hydration

Silver Mirror Foundational Formulas Bundle

Cons
  • May need to go in with another cleanser for heavier makeup

If you’ve ever received a facial from Silver Mirror Bar, you walked out with skin in tip-top shape and better than how you arrived. Well, the expertise of the popular facial spot has translated to skin-care offerings that keep your skin glowing at home. This bundle builds the approach around one mission: to hydrate and moisturize.

Silver Mirror rating: 5/5 stars

A Silver Mirror reviewer says: “The best part of this bundle is that it saves me money while giving me everything I need for my skin-care routine. Highly recommend!”

Best Exfoliating Pads

Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare Alpha Beta® Universal Daily Peel Pads

Pros
  • Reduces appearance of dark scars
Cons
  • May not be best for super sensitive skin

When done correctly, exfoliation offers the best results for clear, smooth skin. Dr. Dennis Gross’s fan-favorite exfoliating pads simplify the process with just two steps: Swipe the first half of the packet along your face, wait two minutes, and then soothe the skin with the second pad.

Sephora rating: 4.5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Whenever a Sephora sale rolls around, I have to restock on these exfoliating pads (the price is a pretty penny, so save where you can!) because my skin loves every drop of product in them. I’m troubled with dark spots (recovering picker), so this box helps to minimize the look of my scars without overly drying my skin or causing more irritation.”—Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture. 

Tatjana Freund is Hearst's Fashion & Luxury Commerce Editor, covering beauty, fashion and more across multiple brands. Previously, she worked at ELLE.com and Marie Claire. She's a fan of whiskey neat, podcasts that give her nightmares, and one time Zoë Kravitz laughed at a joke she made.
